section.p: Log data is stored in the Elasticsearch database. Elasticsearch stores the data in indices. uses Elasticsearch Curator for managing data retention of these indices. Elasticsearch Curator jobs are automatically run by a Cron daemon that executes scheduled commands.
By default, an Elasticsearch index is automatically deleted in if it is older than 60 days. The delete job is executed every day at midnight (UTC).
Proceed as follows to change the data retention settings that were defined when installing the Monitoring Service:

li.p: Log in to the node as a user with root privileges.
Stop the elasticsearch-curator service. For this purpose, run docker-compose stop as follows:
Open the .env file, and update the data retention parameter as required.
Example for deleting the data after a period of 30 days:
li.codeblock: # Data retention for Elasticsearch database # Delete job is executed every day at 12 a.m. UTC MON_ELASTICSEARCH_DATA_RETENTION_DAYS=30

li.p: Start the elasticsearch-curator service. For this purpose, run docker-compose up as follows:

section.p: As soon as the elasticsearch-curator service is up and running, your new data retention policy takes effect.
For details on Elasticsearch Curator, refer to the Elasticsearch Curator documentation. Find details on configuring the Cron daemon in the Ubuntu Wiki.
